conbody.p: Avoid including transitional text in topics.

Transitional text is text that leads the reader to a following topic, or connects the topic to a previous topic. Examples of transitional text include: As we saw previously... and This processed is explained later.... In DITA, topics should be designed to be context-agnostic, so that a topic can be re-used in different publications or outputs, in different sequences. Transitional text reduces re-use opportunities.
